p:
The estimated surface net heat flux coupled response sensitivity constant, λ F, of 5.5 Wm −2K −1 primarily arises through contributions from total turbulent and long-wave flux responses (short-wave response sensitivities are much weaker). The CMIP5-AMIP5 flux component bias on SST bias regression sensitivity constants are −4.8 and −1.3 Wm −2K −1 for the net downwards total turbulent and long-wave flux, respectively (Table 1). The sensitivity of −1.3 Wm −2K −1 for net downward long-wave suggests that around three quarters of the emitted upward long-wave estimated from Stefan’s law (~ 4.8 Wm −2K −1) is re-emitted back towards the surface. The total turbulent flux sensitivity of −4.8 Wm −2K −1 is broadly consistent with observational estimates of its sensitivity for the Southern Ocean region derived from ERAI
35 of < 10 Wm −2K −1. These estimates are both of considerably smaller magnitude than estimates of more than 20 Wm −2K −1 for the total turbulent flux sensitivity from bulk formulae for this region ignoring the atmospheric response.
